but I've got to do an album review of

before I get into it I want to say that
the site the needle drop calm is now

and yeah go check that out when you get
a chance the template isn't up on there
as of right now but it'll be up there
very soon you know as soon as the
weekend's over I have some time on my
hands here we go magic as a Brooklyn
outfit with a new sophomore album and a
new sound to the band's self-titled
debut was the solo effort of their
frontman Luke temple one of those one
guy one for track machine jobs with a
very hazy psychedelic minimalist
approach to sound and structure some
pretty catchy tracks came out of the
project to like tunnel vision and fan
gala BAM links right there give them a
listen of course because of those tracks
and the self-titled debut some buzz
picked up behind the project and here we
go magic expanded into a five-member
band and this new LP is the result
earlier this year the band dropped a
single from the LP before it's released
collector and for me that song was a
really exciting change in direction for
this band just because it sounded just
like something that could have come out
of the kraut rock movement one band that
I want to recommend out of that movement
the group noise and if there are some
sounds that you can most definitely
expect from this genre of music it's
very tight very straightforward drumming
some reserved guitars spacey
synthesizers very linear repetitive song
structures with an emphasis on building
the kind of music that you can really
really get lost in but of course here we
go magic doesn't really exercise this
type of music without putting their own
spin on it there are a lot of very
colorful vocal harmonies throughout this
LP and also a very contemporary studio
clarity to the whole thing I know a lot
of people who are watching this video
may not be from
earlier with krautrock may not have a
palette for krautrock so the sounds on
this LP may be very new to you but
because I'm kind of used to this stuff
because I enjoy this stuff quite a bit
this is a very vintage vintage sounding
LP for me plus it's really really really
obvious that this thing was recorded to
tape which only adds to the old-school
sound of it the drums are very soft and
fluffy and dampened the guitars aren't
very sharp at all the synthesizers and
the bass guitar of course are very warm
and resonant and humming there's a lot
of variety and consistency on this LP to
consistency because the whole thing
really sticks to the minimalist
synth-heavy sound throughout the entire
album no real left hooks when it comes
to that kind of stuff but variety
because there's a ton a ton of great
emotion on this album old world united
is this really snappy chaotic catchy
piece of post-punk while another song he
is this really soft gentle atmospheric
song that builds into nothing short of a
psychedelic freak out my one problem is
that there is a real real pocket full of
tracks on this thing that just kind of
meander for me put a few potholes in the
road either songs that maybe just take a
little too long to say what they're
supposed to say or tracks especially the
two at the end that kind of really don't
do anything but just display an idea and
then quickly duck out before you
actually realize that you're not really
getting a track but more of a motif or a
simple rough drawing of an idea I didn't
mean a track on here that I hate it for
sure however don't expect the
electrifying feel of songs like
collector old-world United even land of
feeling to last throughout the entire
album that's really my only critique of
it some tracks really just kind of pale
in comparison to others I'm feeling a
strong six to a light seven on this
album it is an okay album it's kind of
good they're just a few moments on here
that I didn't really care for that I
could kind of but aside from that I
think this really is a step up from
their last LP in a really interesting
direction I love the sound that these
guys are
pursuing and I really love that they're
bringing back a genre of music putting
their own spin on it and giving it a lot
of sincerity too so if you're looking
for some minimalist rock with a strong
pop sensibility you're looking for
something that is just so in the moment
warm tape sound kind of a vintage
aesthetic something that is really
synthesizer heavy sometimes sober
sometimes psychedelic something that
really tips its hat to krautrock this is
where you want to be here we go magic
pigeons Anthony Fantana here we go
